comment.text: This translation key is used to display a label on a settings page that determines whether an app link opens in the web browser or within the app. It appears as a radio button option in the Portal Settings configuration dialog.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'الفتح فقط في الويب' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Open in web only'. It translates to 'Open only in the web,' which is a literal and somewhat awkward rendering. A more natural and accurate translation would emphasize the restriction to web-only usage.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: فتح في الويب فقط (Fath fi al-web faqat) or استخدام الويب فقط (Istikhdam al-web faqat)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Yalnız vebdə açın' is a literal translation and while understandable, it doesn't flow naturally in Azerbaijani. A more natural and idiomatic translation would be 'Sərfəli vebdə aç' or 'Ancaq vebdə aç'.

The translation "Отвори само в уеб версия" while understandable, isn't the most natural or precise rendering of "Open in web only." A more accurate and common phrasing would be closer to "Само в уеб версия" or "Само в уеб приложение".

The translation "Բացել միայն կայքում" (Bacel miayn kayqem) while understandable, is not the most natural or idiomatic translation of "Open in web only." It's a literal translation, and a more fluent option would convey the intended meaning better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Միայն կայքում բացել" (Miayn kayqem bacel) or "Միայն վեբում բացել" (Miayn veb'um bacel) for a more natural phrasing.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Alleen openen in web' while technically correct, doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'Open in web only'. It sounds a little abrupt. A more natural translation might be 'Slechts in de webversie openen' or 'Uitsluitend in de webversie openen'.

The translation "Открыть только в вебе" is technically correct but sounds unnatural and overly literal. 'Web' in this context refers to the web version of an application, not the internet itself. A more natural translation would focus on the specific functionality.

The translation "වෙබ් අඩවියේ පමණක් විවෘත කරන්න" is a literal translation but doesn't quite convey the intended meaning of 'Open in web only'. It can be interpreted as 'Open only in a website'. A more natural and accurate translation might focus on the restriction of opening only through the web.
While not strictly incorrect, the translation includes an unnecessary verb 'කරන්න'. The meaning is clear without it.
The Slovak translation contains a number '6' at the end of the phrase, which is likely a typo and not part of the intended meaning.

While technically correct, 'Отвори само у прегледачу' is a bit literal and doesn't flow naturally in Serbian.  A more idiomatic translation would be something like 'Само у веб прегледачу' or 'Само за веб преглед'.

The translation 'Yalnızca web'de aç' is grammatically correct but doesn't perfectly convey the meaning of 'Open in web only'. A more natural and idiomatic translation would be 'Sadece web'de aç' or 'Web'de sadece aç'.

The translation 'Chỉ mở bằng web' is technically correct but could be more natural. 'Open in web only' implies opening *exclusively* in the web version, not just *using* the web version. A more precise translation would convey exclusivity.
